channel.title: Private Eye RSS
channel.description: The UK's number one best-selling news and current affairs magazine, edited by Ian Hislop

item.title: OUT NOW! Private Eye issue 1338
item.description: Find out whats in the latest edition of Private Eye. Selected highlights from the UK's number one best-selling news and current affairs magazine including our top stories, cartoons, the Eye crossword, Dumb Britain, Lookalikes, Colemanballs and much more. Plus added extras including our online shop for subscriptions offers, binders and back issues plus the eyePlayer, Covers Library, Blog and Classifieds.

item.title: From In The Back: Morse goaded
item.description: IN CONNIVING with HM Revenue & Customs to cover up dodgy tax deals with multinationals like Vodafone and Goldman Sachs, National Audit Office (NAO) boss Amyas Morse has broken his own rules on the crucial task of dealing correctly with whistleblowers.

item.title: From HP Sauce: MPs iron ladle it on
item.description: MARGARET THATCHER, with her low boredom threshold and distaste for blether, might not have stomached many of the tributes paid to her in parliament.

item.title: From News: Dennis the bloody menace
item.description: DAVID CAMERON, ever keen on people who "do the right thing", authorised his officials to tell the press last week that former HBOS chief executive Sir James Crosby had done just that in giving up his knighthood and a third of his pension entitlement. It was now up to the "consciences and judgement" of other executives whether they followed his example.

item.title: From In The Back: New home, old problem
item.description: BARELY six weeks after a new £5m care home for the elderly opened in Dartmouth, south Devon, police have been called to investigate allegations of neglect.

item.title: From HP Sauce: Love, loyalty and lobbying
item.description: ONE constituency attraction David Miliband may not miss as he quits South Shields for New York is the locally-based lobbying firm Sovereign Strategy.

item.title: From Street Of Shame: The Insomnia of Reason
item.description: HUGH TOMLINSON QC is a man of many talents. Formerly the sultan of superinjunctions - the go-to barrister for philandering celebs seeking gagging orders, including Ryan Giggs and Sir Fred Goodwin - as chairman of Hacked Off he is now the prince of press regulation, drafting the "dab of statute" for the new royal charter. Oh, and in his spare moments he has translated and published no fewer than eight books by Gilles Deleuze, the French "Nietzscheo-structuralist" philosopher.

item.title: From In The Back: Auditing the auditor-general
item.description: A REMARKABLE email from former HM Revenue & Customs boss Dave Hartnett to senior colleagues reveals a major cover-up by Amyas Morse, head of the National Audit Office and the man trusted by parliament to investigate allegations of wrongdoing in Whitehall. The email poses serious questions over Morse's suitability as auditor-general and Britain's principal public spending watchdog.

item.title: From Columnists: The dead Samaritans
item.description: ON 5 March, NHS chief executive Sir David "no accountability" Nicholson told the Commons health select committee that he always takes the concerns of NHS whistleblowers seriously and has always acted appropriately to investigate them when brought to his attention.

item.title: From News: Counsel of despair...
item.description: AS Vicky Pryce sits in the slammer she is brooding none too fondly on the conduct of her lawyers - in particular her leading counsel, Claire Montgomery QC.
